title: What does Trump’s indictment mean for American politics?
description: Donald Trump is expected to become the first former or sitting US president to face criminal charges.

title: Thousands protest in Israel despite judicial overhaul pause
description: Demonstrators take to the streets days after Israeli PM Netanyahu's decision to freeze the controversial proposal.

title: Iran’s Raisi says hijab is the law as women face ‘yoghurt attack’
description: Iranian president says hijab is the law after viral video shows man throwing yoghurt at uncovered women in Masshad.

title: Ukraine decries ‘symbolic blow’ as Russia assumes UN presidency
description: The Kremlin said it planned to 'exercise all its rights' in the role amid anger from Kyiv and allies.

title: Sudan factions delay post-coup deal on civilian rule
description: Signing of political agreement to name a Sudanese civilian government has been delayed to April 6, official says.

title: Eastern Europe must not lag behind on the green transition
description: Doing so could be costly and dangerous for its future development.

title: Ukraine accuses Metropolitan Pavel of condoning Russia’s invasion
description: During court hearing in Kyiv, Metropolitan Pavel rejected claim by Security Service that he condoned Russia's invasion.

title: Pakistan army says ‘terrorists’ from Iran side kill 4 soldiers
description: Incident took place in Kech district in southwestern Baluchistan province, which shares a lawless border with Iran.

title: Israeli police kill Palestinian man near Al-Aqsa in Jerusalem
description: The man killed on Saturday was 26-year-old Mohammad Khaled al-Osaibi from Houra.

title: Tornadoes strike Arkansas and Illinois, killing at least 7 people
description: Destructive weather comes as President Biden tours the aftermath of a deadly tornado that struck Mississippi a week ago.

title: Ukrainian athletes to suffer from government ban: IOC
description: Ukraine says athletes will not participate in Paris Olympics qualifying event if forced to compete against Russians.

title: Israel: The state vs protesters
description: Protests erupt in Israel amid Netanyahu’s government push for broad judicial reform. Plus, Greece’s wiretapping scandal.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Will there be a spring counteroffensive?
description: Ukraine has hinted a counteroffensive could begin as early as April.

title: Can Russia and China succeed in dethroning the dollar?
description: Russia turns to China's yuan as its foreign currency of choice and supports it in trade with other countries.

title: Finland, having cleared last NATO hurdle, heads to elections
description: Is Sanna Marin still popular and do most Finns support NATO? Here are five key things to know.

title: Global network aims to sue Wagner as a ‘terrorist’ organisation
description: Ukrainians in exile are mobilising an army of lawyers to seize Wagner’s assets and hobble Russia’s ability to wage war.

title: Taiwan says Chinese jets carried out ‘combat readiness’ patrols
description: Nine Chinese fighter jets and one military drone crossed the median line in the Taiwan Strait in a 24-hour period.

title: Online influencer Andrew Tate moved to house arrest in Romania
description: Tate, his brother Tristan and two Romanian women were moved to house arrest while under investigation.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 402
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 402nd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Stadium disaster justice loses in Indonesia U-20 World Cup furore
description: Indonesia lost right to host youth World Cup over pro-Palestine stance but disaster victims say justice more important.

title: Russia protests over ‘provocative actions’ by US forces in Syria
description: Russian rear Admiral Oleg Gurinov said the protest was made to the US-led coalition in Syria over actions by US troops.

title: China’s media realities clash over truth about war in Ukraine
description: Pro-Russia and anti-Western media coverage hampers Chinese public's understanding of the reality of war in Ukraine.

title: Experts decry ‘black holes’ in probe of missing Mexican students
description: A panel of experts in Mexico has denounced shortcomings in the investigation of 43 missing Ayotzinapa college students.

title: Biden administration appeals US ruling on health coverage mandate
description: Case could decide whether Obamacare can require insurance providers to cover preventive services for cancer and HIV.
